justification: "Participants were asked to provide a point-estimate for the quantified probability they associate with each phrase" – the 0-to-100 slider served as the measure of how they interpret each verbal probability phrase.

"They were also asked to provide an upper limit for the highest probability … and the lower limit for the lowest probability it may express" – the min and max slider ratings operationalised the subjective range of each phrase.

topic_or_construct: Framing effect on probability phrase interpretation
measured_by: point-estimate sliders in positive and negative clinical framing conditions
justification: "In a final section of the study, participants gave a point-estimate interpretation for each phrase in both a positive and a negative clinical framing" – the same slider ratings, presented within framed clinical sentences, were used to measure framing effects.
